Description: The top of a staff or sceptre in the form of the head and neck of an eagle-gryphon, with ears perked forward and a mane down the neck. Modelled in the round, with a socket in the base of the neck; otherwise solid. Two-piece mould. Brown Nile silt with some mica.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Probably Roman, second to third century AD.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3278)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
